reasoning: New UI component for displaying inspection findings with severity badges and photos. Contained to frontend service with 3-6 files. Follows existing MUI Card patterns already in the codebase. No external integrations or infrastructure changes needed.

scope.notes: Frontend-only component. Will need: FindingCard component, type definitions, potentially integration into inspection views, and maybe styles. Backend already has findings endpoints.

integrations.notes: Uses existing MUI components (@mui/material already installed). Backend API for findings already exists at /projects/{project_id}/inspections/{inspection_id}/findings.

infrastructure.notes: Pure frontend component. No infrastructure or database changes required. Backend findings model and API already exist.

knowledge.notes: Codebase already uses MUI Card components extensively. Emotion styling is established. Photo handling patterns exist via react-dropzone and file API endpoints. Severity badge implementation may need creation but follows standard MUI Chip/Badge patterns.

concerns: Need to understand exact data structure from backend findings API
Ensure photo URLs are properly generated from storage endpoints
Severity levels need to match backend enum/types
risk.notes: Low risk frontend component. No breaking changes to existing functionality. Main consideration is ensuring component props match backend data structure for findings.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Frontend-only UI component with no security implications, database changes, or API modifications. Minimal validation with unit tests (if test infrastructure exists) is sufficient.
